body: Hello Mostapha, Could you share again the link to your paper about modeling ETFE in daylighting simulations. I found the conversation below between you and Claudio and Tatos from 2015. However, the link you shared back then is not valid anymore.  I would really appreciate it. Thank you, Helena --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Permalink](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/xn/detail/2985220:Comment:1412560) Reply by [Mostapha Sadeghipour Roudsari](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topic/listForContributor?user=2o71qkfqc6voq) on November 30, 2015 at 6:35pm Hi Caludio and Tatos, For Daylight modeling you can use Radiance's image-mapping. I published a paper recently that discusses the process ([http://www.simaud.org/2015/program.php#a-new-approach-to-modeling-f...](http://www.simaud.org/2015/program.php#a-new-approach-to-modeling-frit-patterns-for-daylight-simulation)). They haven't send it online but I can email you the paper if you're interested to read it in details. [](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/profile/MostaphaSadeghipour)[Permalink](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/xn/detail/2985220:Comment:1412565) Reply by [Mostapha Sadeghipour Roudsari](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topic/listForContributor?user=2o71qkfqc6voq) on November 30, 2015 at 7:44pm Here is the link to the paper: [https://copy.com/okY7JzPoVjbF6LrL](https://copy.com/okY7JzPoVjbF6LrL)
